meanings.definition: A thin slice of meat, typically veal or chicken, that is coated in breadcrumbs and fried.
meanings.sent1: For dinner, I cooked a delicious escalope of chicken.
meanings.sent2: The chef served a crispy escalope of veal with a side of mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent3: At the restaurant, the escalope of veal danced on my plate before I devoured it.
meanings.sent4: The escalope of chicken was a golden treasure hidden beneath a crunchy breadcrumb crust.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the sizzling escalope filled the kitchen, making everyone's mouth water.

meanings.definition: To prepare meat by slicing it thinly and pounding it to make it tender.
meanings.sent1: I will escalope the chicken breasts before marinating them.
meanings.sent2: She escaloped the veal to ensure it would cook quickly and evenly.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to escalope the steak, much to the surprise of the customers.
meanings.sent4: After escaloping the meat, it was ready to be seasoned and cooked to perfection.
meanings.sent5: Escaloping the pork chops made them so tender that they practically melted in your mouth.
